uk.nhs.interoperability.infrastructure

Interface ITKAckDetails

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ITKInfrastructureAck

    public interface ITKAckDetails
    Interface representing the pertinent information contained within an ITK Infrastructure Ack. Typically this information is used to convey the Ack (or Nack) information back to the originator of the message to which this Ack/Nack pertains.

    It is an application responsibility to correlate the Ack/Nack back with the original message based on the tracking reference getTrackingRef() and getIntendedRecipient()*.

    * Note In the 0.1 version of the API getIntendedRecipient() is not strictly required to correlating responses, however if the API scope is expanded to support mutli-destination messaging the intended recipient would also need to be used in the correlation
    Since:
    version 0.1
    Author:
    Michael Odling-Smee, Nicholas Jones

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ITKAddress getIntendedRecipient()
      Provides the ITKAddress for the intended recipient of the message being acknowledged
      ITKMessagingException getNackError()
      Obtains details about the error for which the Nack is being generated.
      String getReportingIdentity()
      Get the identity of the node that originated the InfrastructureAck This may be different to the getIntendedRecipient() if a nack was generated by an intermediary node
      String getServiceRef()
      The service identifier from the message being acknowledged
      String getTrackingRef()
      The tracking id reference from the message being acknowledged
      boolean isNack()
      Convenient method to simply establish whether the ITKAckDetails represents an Ack or Nack

    • Method Detail

      • getTrackingRef

        String getTrackingRef()
        The tracking id reference from the message being acknowledged
        Returns:
        A String representation of the id (note this should be a UUID) TODO - should the method actually return a UUID?

      • getServiceRef

        String getServiceRef()
        The service identifier from the message being acknowledged
        Returns:
        A string representation of the service - e.g. urn:nhs-itk:services:201005:SendCDADocument-v2-0

      • getReportingIdentity

        String getReportingIdentity()
        Get the identity of the node that originated the InfrastructureAck This may be different to the getIntendedRecipient() if a nack was generated by an intermediary node
        Returns:
        A string representation of the reporting identity

      • getIntendedRecipient

        ITKAddress getIntendedRecipient()
        Provides the ITKAddress for the intended recipient of the message being acknowledged
        Returns:
        an ITKAddress representing the logical addressee information of the intended recipient of the message being acknowledged

      • getNackError

        ITKMessagingException getNackError()
        Obtains details about the error for which the Nack is being generated. If the the ITKAckDetails is an Ack (rather than Nack) then there is no associated error information and null is returned.
        Returns:
        An ITKMessagingException encapsulating the error details

      • isNack

        boolean isNack()
        Convenient method to simply establish whether the ITKAckDetails represents an Ack or Nack
        Returns:
        true if it is a Nack (i.e. getNackError() is not null), false otherwise
